abstract: Formation of government cabinet in Afghanistan is marred by competing ethnic interests and charges about qualifications of candidates; Pres Ashraf Ghani and rival Abdullah Abdullah work out compromise proposal for cabinet.
lead_paragraph: Ethnic groups are fighting over representation, one candidate is wanted by Interpol, and one dropped out because he could not provide enough jobs to his would-be supporters.

byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein, Jawad Sukhanyar and Fazal Muzhary contributed reporting.

snippet: Ethnic groups are fighting over representation, one candidate is wanted by Interpol, and one dropped out because he could not provide enough jobs to his would-be supporters.

headline.main: Charges and Clashing Interests Mar Selection of a Cabinet for Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Charges and Clashing Interests Mar Selection of a Cabinet for Afghanistan
